item.title: Sonic Prime
item.description: Currently working on the new animated Sonic the Hedgehog serie for Netflix.

item.title: Spidey and his Amazing Friends
item.description: I worked on 6 shorts and 10 episodes of the first season. Each episode was 11 minutes long and usually had between 4 or 5 keyshots. Most of the time I was in charge of 2 or 3 that had effects. My role was to setup keyshots in lighting and compositing beforehand. I would then work with my team on the rest of the episode.

item.title: Lego Marvel Avengers: Climate Conundrum
item.description: My first project on episodic. The process is quite different than feature. You rely on being the most efficient possible, and setting things up globally. One unique light rig to rule them all. I worked on episode 1 and 3. My sequences were for the most part heavy in effects (snow storm and sand storm).

item.title: The Willoughbys
item.description: Worked on multiple sequences setting up lighting mood and compositing template on master and keyshots. I led one the sequence in the candy factory, the biggest sequence of the film over 80 shots. I worked on most of the keyshots. I provided feedback to artists based on notes from the production designer and supervisor, and supported them until final approval.

item.title: Spider-Man Into the Spider-Verse
item.description: A very special project. The amount of work done in compositing was tremendous, most of the look was done in Nuke and where we could be creative. I worked on multiple sequences on lighting and shared some shots for the compositing task.

item.title: Smallfoot
item.description: First project with Katana. After one week of training that taught us the basics of Katana, we jumped into production. Making the white characters readable on white snow was challenging. Scene optimization was a must for a show with crowd of hairy characters. I worked on multiple sequences from lighting to compositing, 3D stereo included.

item.title: The Lego Ninjago Movie
item.description: My first animated feature, I believe this is one of the experience where I learnt the most in my career. I worked on multiple sequences from lighting to compositing, 3D stereo included.
